definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: Moreover, the skull has features resembling those of contemporary Asians.

sentences.english: The main difficulty of off-line handwritten signature verification is feature extraction.

sentences.english: Micro - electroforming is characterized by both resist - patterned electroplating and resist - structural electrodepositing.

sentences.english: Offenses with this characteristic usually will be encountered as assimilative crimes.

sentences.english: Resilience is not simply an individual characteristic or a psychological phenomenon.

sentences.chinese: 目的研究脑膜瘤临床病理特征及预后。

sentences.english: Watershed infarcts have a characteristic distribution in the brain.
